intro: Suregada capuronii, commonly known as the Philippine orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical forest environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, while its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture from the air. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
